intro: Centaurea diania, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Bladder Campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive bladdery structure in the center. Centaurea diania is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
